title: Raise MSRV to 1.63
body: Closes #78.

title: adds a Field::try_from_rng method
body: This is stacked on #126

title: Relax `Sized` requirements on the rng
body: This is stacked on #122

title: Bump rand to 0.9
body: https://github.com/rust-random/rand/releases/tag/0.9.0

title: Fix unnecessary as_mut()
body: This `as_mut()` was causing type inference problems after I added an array crate (hybrid-array) to my rust-project using ff-derive. Removing it worked and made the macro compile again.

title: Make derive work for all primes. Fixes #84.
body:
Derive failed for some primes because the `sqrt` function derivation failed. This PR makes `derive` work for all primes.

This fixes #84

title: More trait changes
body: This ports the remaining useful parts of the [`pasta_curves::arithmetic::FieldExt` trait](https://docs.rs/pasta_curves/0.4.1/pasta_curves/arithmetic/trait.FieldExt.html) onto `PrimeField` and two new traits (that are added because we can't use associated constants in trait method signatures yet).

title: Add `core::iter::{Sum, Product}` bounds on `Field`
body: Closes zkcrypto/ff#95.

title: Add associated constants of type `Self` to `Field` and `PrimeField`
body:
We now require that the type implementing `Field`, and its particular values for these constants, can be constructed in a const context. Once upon a time this might have been onerous, but it should now be a reasonable requirement given our MSRV of 1.56.0.

Closes zkcrypto/ff#87.

title: Breaking additions to the `Field` trait
body:
These new trait methods are moved from the `FieldExt` trait in `pasta_curves`, where we had placed them while figuring out their APIs.

Closes #33.

title: Use `checked_shr` instead of `>>` in `Field::random`
body:
In some edge cases, `REPR_SHAVE_BITS` could be 64, causing an overflow
if using `>>`. So use `checked_shr` instead.

This overflow can be reproduced using the following modulus:
```
#[derive(PrimeField)]
#[PrimeFieldModulus = "39402006196394479212279040100143613805079739270465446667948293404245721771496870329047266088258938001861606973112319"]
#[PrimeFieldGenerator = "19"]
#[PrimeFieldReprEndianness = "little"]
struct F384p([u64; 7]);
```

title: chore(derive): allow too_many_args at mont_reduce
body:
This PR silences the clippy warning with `ff = { version = "0.12", features = ["derive"] }`  when following the README.md example in a new project, and running clippy, which will then report on the `#[derive(PrimeField)]` line a `clippy::too_many_arguments`. The limit in 1.56.1 is 7, of which only the `mont_reduce` goes over with 9. I cannot see any other candidates aside from `mont_reduce`.

The warning can be silenced around with a module wide `#![allow(clippy::too_many_arguments)]`. We ran into this when upgrading to "0.12" because it had been fixed in the fork along with the code later PR'd as #72, but I missed upstreaming the fix before.

title: fix derive-inside-macro
Upgrade bitvec
body:
Fixes #70. Upgrades MSRV from 1.51 to 1.56, matching bitvec's, upgrades bitvec to "1".

Follow-up to #72, which is hopefully merged and a patch version released first. There shouldn't be any major conflicts, but the workflow will need to be fixed for ~the nightly doc lint job's rust version (#72 changed it to 1.51, needs to be 1.56 now)~ .. ended up doing that in this branch as well, latest nightly [rustdoc has some issues](https://github.com/eqlabs/ff/runs/4964639285?check_suite_focus=true#step:5:22).

title: Fix bitvec dep leaking
body:
Fixes #69. See comments for the ci change reproducing the issue.

Adds a new feature for ff_derive: `bits`, which controls the code dependent on bitvec on derived output. `ff_derive/bits` is toggled when enabling "derive_bits" on the `ff` crate. The re-exports of `ff` are also adjusted to only contain `bitvec` when `ff/bits` is enabled.

title: Enable constant-time usage of trait methods
body: Breaking change, so requires a minor version bump.

title: Extra bounds
body: Requires a minor version bump.

title: Add traits and structs for batch inversion using Montgomery's trick
Remove unused imports
body: After this the `std` feature flag is unused, but I figure we can just leave it in, in case we want to add `std`-only traits in future.

title: Add a changelog
body: I added back-changes from the 0.8.0 and 0.9.0 releases.

title: Add `bits` feature; factor out PrimeFieldBits
body:
(NOTE: breaking change)

Makes `bitvec` an optional dependency by factoring the types and methods which depend on it into their own trait - `PrimeFieldBits`.
